Chemical vapor deposition is also widely applied to prepare 2D materials, such as graphene 69 and transition metal sulfides. 70 The materials obtained with this method have the advantages of higher crystallinity and fewer defects, but the yield is often low and the performance is not very reproducible, apparently not suitable for large scales.
